analysis.Summary: Vue 3 single-file component that renders a sortable icon as an SVG consisting of four horizontal bars whose widths change depending on the 'order' prop (ascending or descending).
analysis.Purpose: Provide a reusable sort icon component that visually represents ascending or descending ordering in UI lists or tables.

Components.name: IconSort
Components.role: Root component that encapsulates the SVG markup and exposes 'fill' and 'order' props for customization.

Functions.name: defineProps
Functions.description: Vue Composition API helper (script setup) used to declare and type component props.

fill.description: Color value for the bars (accepts any valid CSS color).

order.description: Determines bar width logic; either 'asc' or 'desc'.

Dependencies: transition-linear (global or framework-provided CSS utility class)
analysis.Usage: Import the component and embed it in templates: import IconSort from 'modules/icons/navigation/IconSort.vue'; then use <IconSort :order="'asc'" fill="#333"/> to display the icon.
Notes: No scoped <style> section â€“ styling relies on global CSS variables and utility classes.
Reactive width bindings in <rect> elements switch between fixed widths (8, 16, 24, 32) based on the 'order' prop.
Minimal footprint: purely presentational, with no internal methods or state apart from props.
